Definition at line 137 of file GrMaterialPass.h.

GrMaterialPass * GrMaterialPass::Clone (  )  const

creates a clone of this material pass.

it just so happens we can use the copy constructor. It is recommended that this function is used instead of the default copy constructor since there is no way to make the default copy constructor private.

return the new material pass.

Definition at line 148 of file GrMaterialPass.h.

void GrMaterialPass::Init ( unsigned int  passNumber,
const SMaterialPassInfo &  passInfo 
)

for array initialization or material rebuilding.

public methods

initialize the pass.

create a new user param block.

determine what states we need to enable/disable for rendering.

make sure we don't have any overlapping states. This shouldn't be possible given the intended logic.
